direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods add or update attributes, but 'put' replaces existing attributes while 'add' allows duplicates.
Both methods manipulate the attribute list, but 'remove' deletes an attribute while 'add' inserts one.
Both methods handle multiple attribute operations, but 'addAll' adds all attributes from another set while 'add' adds a single attribute.
Both methods modify the state of the Attributes object, but 'normalize' changes the case of keys while 'add' inserts new keys.
Both methods handle attribute keys, but 'deduplicate' removes duplicates while 'add' adds new keys.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require URL parser initialization.
Environment setup is required before validating URLs.
Both methods verify URL formats and handle similar exceptions.
